newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore share market seen sideways, range-bound.
newsitem.headline: Singapore share market seen sideways, range-bound.

text.p: The Singapore stock market was seen trading sideways on Thursday amid a lack of fresh market moving news, dealers said.
"The market should trade in a band, with a ceiling at 2,200 and floor at 2,100," a dealer with a foreign bank said.
"It should hold as long as there is no major volume on a downtrend," he added.
On Wednesday, the key Straits Times Industrials Index ended 19.42 points up at 2,135.46 in thin volume.
Dealers were doubtful if the index could reach 2,200 given the lack of interest by foreign funds in Singapore.
One dealer said the Singapore market was at best neutral.
Dealers felt recent profit-taking in Malaysia would dampened sentiment on Malaysian counters here.
